page.text: www.jessicaerindesigns.com
New York, New York
jromberger1@gmail.com
Graduation: May 2015
Bachelor of Science Degree in Recreation, Park & Tourism Management with an emphasis in Event Planning

text.b: XO Group, Inc.- Public Relations Intern

page.text: Jan. 2015- Present
Assist the Public Relations team in creating a recognizable name for our three brands- The Knot, The Nest and The Bump
Report to the Director of Communications, Senior Public Relations Manager, and Public Relations Manager; Keep track of any
media coverage any of our brands receive and document it, as well as the impression and placement numbers; Put together weekly
reports of impression and placement numbers
The Bump Pump & Dump Validation Tour (Ongoing): Promoted the comedy show across the country by writing pitches to
reporters, bloggers, TV and radio stations to cover the various shows and set up interviews
The Knot Dream Wedding: Assist in the planning process and coordination of this live-streamed wedding taking place in June
2015; Kept track of partners, trade-outs and businesses we are working with
2015): Kept track of the entire RSVP list of 500+ attendees for this event intending to
break the record for the World’s Largest Champagne Tasting; Assisted in set up, coordination of tech components, and was on site
during the event

text.b: Jessica Erin Designs- Floral Designer & Blogger

page.text: Feb. 2014- Present
Created the floral design for four weddings and one fraternity gala in 2014, working with my clients’ budgets to turn their visions
into reality; Worked with several wholesalers for ordering my materials; Created 20+ centerpieces at a time; Kept track of my own
finances and marketing efforts
Designed and created various décor aspects of weddings, including the favors, name cards, and guest book
Currently creating blog posts to share my experiences, DIY projects, beauty interests, and more with followers; Website is also a
portfolio for all of the design work I have done:
www.jessicaerindesigns.com

text.b: Pennsylvania Pink Zone- Executive Director’s Intern

page.text: May 2014- Dec 2014
Worked to increase awareness and promote the Pennsylvania Pink Zone breast cancer foundation in the Penn State community
Attended all meetings with Executive Director including fundraising meetings, Pink Zone Game planning meetings, event
preparation meetings and sponsorship meetings; Organized data and created excel docs for easier and future reference of data
Little Black Dress Goes Pink (October 2014): Coordinated and implemented this fashion show intended to raise money for breast
cancer research; Helped with securing sponsorships from businesses in Downtown State College for the fashion show; Helped
with décor and set up for the event and on-site during the event

text.b: Penn State Career Services Center- Event Planning Intern

page.text: Worked alongside Lead Career Fairs Coordinator and Associate Director for Programming as general event planning assistant for
Spring Career Days and other Career Services events; Assisted in employer communication and outreach as well as publicity for
the different events
Resumania (March 2014): Lead planner in coordinating this event, held before Spring Career Days, for students to have their
resumes reviewed by Human Resource Professionals

text.b: Penn State Advanced Floral Designers-Floral Designer

page.text: Sept. 2012- May 2014
Created elaborate floral arrangements for the Nittany Lion Inn, Penn Stater Conference Center, and other hospitality and career
services properties; Worked with hotel management to create theme designed arrangements for special events and conferences
Assisted in teaching other aspiring florists the basics of floral design during a class on Thursday evenings
June 2013- Dec. 2013
Worked as one of two florists; created 15+ arrangements for our showcase each week and created arrangements upon orders sent to
our store; Made arrangements for a variety of events including wedding centerpieces, bridal bouquets, corsages and boutonnieres
Assisted in social media marketing efforts of the store, as well as redecorating the store

text.b: Nittany Mountain Biking Association Open Mic Night-Event Planner

page.text: Planned, coordinated, and implemented an Open Mic Night at Webster’s Café in Downtown State College to raise awareness and
fundraise for the Nittany Mountain Biking Association (NMBA)
Worked alongside the President of NMBA and seven other Penn State students to market the Open Mic Night, plan the logistics
and risk management strategies, and solicit sponsors for our event

text.b: Susan G. Komen Philadelphia- Intern for Event Coordinator

page.text: Assisted the Event Coordinator in coordinating Race for the Cure 2014, Pink Tie Ball, Volunteers Luncheon, as well as other
fundraising and awareness events
Assisted the Educational Director in the production of the Asian American Women’s Health Awareness Day 2013
Volunteered at Race for the Cure and worked as part of the Susan G. Komen Team at the Asian American Women’s Health Day at
the Sheraton Hotel in Philadelphia
Programming in Recreation and Leisure Services - Peer Mentor University Park, PA Jan. 2014- May 2014
Guided and assisted a team of eight RPTM students through planning and implementing a community event for the non-profit
Sounds
Facilitated team meetings and kept students on track with the intensive course load
Acted as a sounding board for any ideas, questions or concerns, as I had completed the class last semester
Edited assignments before students turned them in to the professor, and graded their Weekly Team Reports- a recap of all class
meetings that week and all material that was covered
Aug. 2013-April 2014
Selected to be among 32 female leaders at Penn State to further my understanding of the key dimensions of leadership, expand
network with alumnae leaders, and work on enhancing knowledge of my own leadership capacity through a yearlong program

text.b: Basic Floral Design Class- Teacher’s Assistant

page.text: Attended the Basic Floral Design class every week and assisted the instructor in teaching the basics of floral arranging, including
doing demonstrations, administering quizzes, and responding to emails
Assisted instructor in selection of flowers to be ordered every week for the class as well as the advanced arrangements done for the
hotels and other properties on campus; Sorted and organized flowers upon delivery
Taught a class lecture and lead the demonstration when the professor was unable to make it to class
The Bridal Society
October 2014- Present
